meanings.definition: The quality of being unoriginal or lacking creativity.
meanings.sent1: Her derivativeness was evident in her repetitive ideas.
meanings.sent2: The derivativeness of the artwork made it hard to distinguish from others.
meanings.sent3: Despite his derivativeness, he always managed to put a smile on people's faces.
meanings.sent4: The derivativeness of his writing was like a faded photocopy of someone else's work.
meanings.sent5: The derivativeness of the song was so strong that it felt like a copy of a copy of a copy.

meanings.definition: The state of being derived from something else.
meanings.sent1: The derivativeness of the theory was clear from its similarities to existing ideas.
meanings.sent2: His derivativeness from his father was evident in his mannerisms.
meanings.sent3: The derivativeness of the recipe made it taste like a blend of other dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her derivativeness from her role model was like a shadow following her every move.
meanings.sent5: The derivativeness of the building's design was a clear homage to classical architecture.

meanings.definition: The act of producing a derivative.
meanings.sent1: His derivativeness in creating new products was praised by the company.
meanings.sent2: The derivativeness of the process led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent3: The derivativeness of the experiment resulted in unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent4: Her derivativeness in the laboratory was like a magician conjuring new elements.
meanings.sent5: The derivativeness of his approach revolutionized the industry.
